intro: Cassebeera tenuifolia, commonly known as the pink hibiscus mealybug plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators. However, it is also known to host the pink hibiscus mealybug, which can be a pest in some regions.
